-   **Rarity note:** Broad range across the United States from February to August

## Natural history notes

Brown-belted Bumble Bees (Bombus griseocollis) are characterized by their black wings, black head, short dense hairs on their thorax with a belt of brown hairs. The Queen is much larger than both the males and workers. Brown-belted Bumble Bees emerge early in the spring and cease activity early in the fall. Their food and hosts include numerous families of flowering plants.
